thread.title: Man Sentenced to 10 Years for Fraud Over Unsolicited Texts

author: Corinne Ramey
title: Man Sentenced to 10 Years for Fraud Over Unsolicited Texts
text:
A Manhattan judge sentenced the head of a mobile-phone aggregation company to 10 years in prison on Monday for a multimillion-dollar fraud scheme in which consumers were charged for unsolicited text messages containing horoscopes, trivia and celebrity gossip.
In December, a jury convicted Darcy Wedd, chief executive of Mobile Messenger, of wire fraud, conspiracy to commit money laundering and other crimes.
